text: The Raymond Danowski Poetry Library is a poetry library at Emory University in Atlanta, Georgia, U.S.. It was established in 2004 after Raymond Danowski, the son-in-law of sculptor Henry Moore, donated his collection of "75,000 volumes of verse, believed to be the largest private library of 20th-century poetry in English," to the university. ==References== Category:Emory University Category:Libraries in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Libraries established in 2004 Category:2004 establishments in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Poetry organizations
title: Raymond Danowski Poetry Library
